lead_paragraph: An Amtrak train carrying 153 people derailed early today after it clipped a tank car that had fallen off a parallel track. Nine people were injured, none of them seriously, said an Amtrak spokeswoman. The 16-car train, the Coast Starlight, was traveling from Seattle to Los Angeles when it derailed just before 2 a.m. north of Dunsmuir, Calif., near Mount Shasta.
abstract: Amtrak train derails in northern California after clipping tank car that had fallen off parallel track; nine people are hurt, none seriously (S)
